questions.question_text: A network architect considers a Cisco HyperFlex design solution for a company. The proposed solution is for a virtual environment that is not performance- sensitive, but the solution must have high storage capacity and a low cost. Which Cisco HyperFlex storage configuration should be used?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Indeed, hybrid node types such as the Cisco HyperFlex HX220c-M5SX Hybrid Node contain several SAS hard drives.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/UCS_CVDs/hx_4_vsi_vmware_esxi.html#_Toc41894853

comments.content: yes, but still it would lack the rx on the source interface line
I think C is correct on the basis that Interface Ethernet 1/3 is a typo and it should really be 1/5

discussion.content:
So, there is actually no correct answer option. Answer should be:

switch(config)# interface ethernet 1/5
switch(config-if)# switchport monitor rate-limit 1G

switch(config)# monitor session 2
switch(config-monitor)# destination interface ethernet 1/5
switch(config-monitor)# source interface ethernet 1/3 rx
The answer C s correct because the command rate-limit 1G is configured on the source interface eth 1/3

No correct answer. 

switch(config)# interface ethernet 1/5
switch(config-if)# switchport monitor rate-limit 1G

switch(config)# monitor session 2
switch(config-monitor)# destination interface ethernet 1/5
switch(config-monitor)# source interface ethernet 1/3 rx
Agree. Correct answer is not there.

questions.question_text: An engineer needs to perform a backup of user roles and locales from Cisco UCS Manager to replicate the setting to a different fabric interconnect. The engineer wants to review the file before importing it to a target fabric interconnect. Which backup type must be selected to meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
C is correct.

System configurationâ€”An XML file that includes all system configuration settings such as usernames, roles, and locales. You can use the file generated from this backup to import these configuration settings to the original fabric interconnect or to a different fabric interconnect. You cannot use this file for a system restore.
https://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/unified_computing/ucs/sw/gui/config/guide/141/UCSM_GUI_Configuration_Guide_141_chapter43.html

Selected Answer: C
c is correct
A and E are correct. You do specify a reboot policy when creating a Maintenance Policy (you have to tick the radio button "user-ack" under reboot policy).

Selected Answer: AE
A and e!

https://community.cisco.com/t5/data-center-documents/understanding-and-configuring-cisco-ucs-maintenance-policy/ta-p/3141490
"When creating a maintenance policy you have to select a reboot policy which defines when the server can reboot once the changes are applied."
I think D, E is the correct answer. There is no Reboot Policy in UCS.

questions.question_text: An engineer creates a service profile in Cisco UCS Manager and must assign a policy that reboots blades when changes are applied. The changes must be applied only after user acknowledgment. Which two policies must be configured to meet these requirements? (Choose two.)
